case_title: ABDUL RAHIM ZUBAIR BUTT vs COMPETENT AUTHORITY and 8 others
court: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Subordinate Service Tribunal

accussed_details.name: Abdul Rahim Zubair Butt
allegation: Impersonation as General of Pakistan Army
Attempt to pressurize Chief Justice to cancel transfer orders

complaint_summary: The appellant allegedly made a telephone call impersonating as a General of Pakistan Army to pressurize the Chief Justice of High Court to cancel his transfer orders.
investigation_summary: An Inquiry Committee was constituted, which issued multiple show-cause notices to the appellant. The committee found the appellant guilty of misconduct after reviewing evidence, including call records and judicial files.
judgment_summary: The appeal was dismissed as time-barred. The tribunal upheld the findings of the Inquiry Committee and the competent authority, declaring the appellant guilty of misconduct and impersonation.
punishment: Removal from judicial service effective from 21-8-2002.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued that the inquiry was conducted improperly and violated principles of natural justice.
Respondents argued that the appellant pursued remedies in wrong forums and failed to justify delay in filing the appeal.
Tribunal held that the appellant's misconduct was proven and the appeal was time-barred.
statutes: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Removal from Service (Special Powers) Act, 2001
sections: Section 9 of the Azad Jammu and Kashmir Removal from Service (Special Powers) Act, 2001

witness_statement.Deputy Registrars: Confirmed calls were made to their numbers before and after the call to the Chief Justice.
witness_statement.Advocates: Provided affidavits claiming appellant was present in court during alleged call.

key_issues: Whether the appeal was filed within the prescribed period of limitation.
Whether the appellant committed misconduct by impersonating as a General of Pakistan Army.
Whether the inquiry process adhered to legal provisions.

maxims.Audi alteram partem: The appellant argued that he was not given a fair opportunity to cross-examine witnesses.

legal_terms.Competent Authority: Defined under Section 2(a) of the Special Powers Act.

words_and_phrases.Time-barred: Legal action not filed within the prescribed limitation period.
words_and_phrases.Impersonation: Falsely representing oneself as another person.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves allegations of misconduct and impersonation against a judicial officer. The tribunal dismissed the appeal as time-barred and upheld the findings of the Inquiry Committee and competent authority, declaring the appellant guilty of misconduct. The appellant's arguments regarding procedural violations were rejected, and his removal from service was deemed justified.

statutes: Azad Jammu and Kashmir Removal from Service (Special Powers) Act, 2001

key_facts.employment: Judicial service of Azad Jammu and Kashmir, serving as Judge Family Court, Bagh
key_facts.misconduct_allegation: Impersonation as a General of the Army and misuse of telephone to influence transfer orders
key_facts.competent_authority: Chief Justice of High Court of Azad Jammu and Kashmir
key_facts.representation: Submitted to Prime Minister of AJ&K, reinstatement ordered but not implemented
key_facts.subsequent_appeals: Petition for leave to appeal dismissed by apex Court; appeal filed before Service Tribunal

tribunal_findings.limitation_period: Appeal filed beyond prescribed period of 90 days; delay of 42 days not justified
tribunal_findings.jurisdiction: Prime Minister not competent authority for judicial officers; Chief Justice is the competent authority

merits.misconduct_proven: Telephone calls made from appellant's residence; impersonation and misconduct established
merits.procedural_compliance: Inquiry conducted per statutory provisions; appellant afforded opportunity to respond
